words.definition: If something is analytic, it is related to logic and reasoning.
words.example: The analytic article criticized the new plan and presented one of its own.

words.definition: To assert a fact or belief means to state it with confidence.
words.example: He asserted that his mother’s cooking was better than his best friend’s.

words.definition: A bachelor is an unmarried man.
words.example: Since he was a bachelor, Jason did his shopping by himself.

words.definition: Calculus is an advanced type of mathematics.
words.example: By using calculus, scientists determined the planet’s orbit.

words.definition: If something is celestial, it is related to the sky or to outer space.
words.example: Comets are celestial objects that are rarely seen.

words.definition: If something is cognitive, it is related to learning and knowing things.
words.example: After her accident, her cognitive abilities were still very strong.

words.definition: A collision is the act of two things hitting each other.
words.example: The collision between the two cars created a loud noise.

words.definition: If someone is competent, they are able to do something well.
words.example: The competent employee was quickly promoted to manager.

words.definition: A diploma is a certificate proving that someone has completed a course of study.
words.example: After four years of college, Mary finally received her diploma.

words.definition: To excel at something means to be very good at it.
words.example: The boy excelled at play the piano.

words.definition: Geology is the study of the Earth’s structure and rocks.
words.example: Because he studied geology, he knew how the mountains were formed.

words.definition: To harness something means to control and use it, usually to make energy.
words.example: The solar panels harness the sun’s energy to make electricity.

words.definition: An intellect is a person’s ability to understand things and think intelligently.
words.example: She was known for her quick intellect and humor.

words.definition: If someone is keen, they are intelligent, sharp, or focused.
words.example: The dog has a keen sense of smell.

words.definition: Mythology is a group of stories from a particular culture or religion.
words.example: Egyptian mythology is full of many different gods and goddesses.

words.definition: Physiology is the study of the way that the parts of living things work.
words.example: His expert knowledge of physiology helped him understand how the heart works.

words.definition: If something is radioactive, then it lets out radiation.
words.example: Radioactive materials can be very dangerous to people.

words.definition: Relativity is a theory about the way that objects move through time and space.
words.example: Einstein’s theory of relativity changed the way people thought about the universe.

words.definition: Sociology is the study of people, societies, and their behavior.
words.example: Sociology teaches us about the different cultures around the world.

words.definition: If something is theoretical, it is based on theory rather than experience or practice.
words.example: His idea was purely theoretical and had never been tested.
